Nothing in this paragraph shall prejudice any player from raising the same Point of Order again."

(b) Enact the following as a new rule:

"1. At any time, any player may nominate a Proxy by typing "Proxy:" and the name of another player in the Telegram voting thread.

2. The named player shall, within one calendar day of being nominated, indicate their acceptance or rejection of Proxy status by typing "Proxy accepted" or "Proxy rejected" in the Telegram voting thread, referencing the original message. If the nominated player fails to respond within one calendar day either accepting or rejecting the Proxy, the Proxy nomination shall be automatically rejected.

3. A player who has validly nominated a Proxy under paragraph 1, and whose nominated Proxy has accepted the Proxy under paragraph 2, shall be deemed to have an Active Proxy.

4. When a player with an Active Proxy wishes to resume control, the player shall type "Proxy revoked" in the Telegram voting thread, and the player shall be deemed to no longer have an Active Proxy.

5. When a player who has accepted a Proxy wishes to end that Proxy, the player shall type in the Telegram voting thread "Proxy ended for" and the name of the player for whom they wish to cease being Proxy. Upon ending the Proxy, the player who nominated the Proxy shall be deemed to no longer have an Active Proxy.

6. When nominating a Proxy, the player may specify when the Proxy will end. At the specified end time, control shall return to the player as if they had typed "Proxy revoked" in the Telegram voting thread. If a date is specified without a time, the end date shall be construed as the end of the named day. If no end date is specified, the Proxy continues until further notice.

7. Specifying an end date does not preclude a player from revoking or ending an Active Proxy in accordance with paragraph 4 and 5 at any time earlier than the designated end date.

8. Any messages in the Telegram voting thread sent by a player with an Active Proxy are considered void, except for any message of the form "Proxy revoked".

9. While acting as Proxy, the named player shall be entitled to one additional vote for each Proxy they exercise. When voting on another player's behalf, the Proxy must type "Proxy vote for" followed by the name of the player on behalf of whom they are making the vote, followed by "Yes" or "No". That vote shall be counted as if it were a vote by the person on behalf of whom the Proxy is voting. This takes precedence over Rule 208.

10. Messages in the Telegram voting thread nominating, revoking, accepting, rejecting, or ending a Proxy, sent in accordance with this rule, are exempt from all time and day restrictions. In particular, such messages may be posted at any time without being considered void. This takes precedence over Rule 307.

11. No player who is already acting as Proxy for another player may nominate a Proxy for themselves, without first ending the Proxy they have previously accepted.

12. No player who has been nominated as Proxy for another player may nominate a Proxy for themselves, without first rejecting the original nomination.

13. No player may be nominated as a Proxy if they have already nominated a Proxy for themselves.

14. No player may act as Proxy for more than one other player at any given time.

15. A nomination of a Proxy which contravenes paragraphs 11-14 shall not apply, and any such nomination or acceptance shall constitute a void message.

16. If, at any time under Rule 214, a player who has an Active Proxy is called to be Judge, then the Proxy shall become the Judge for that Point of Order, unless the Proxy is either the player who invoked the Point of Order, or the player whose allocated day it is under Rule 201, in which case the player next in the List of Judges for that Point of Order shall become the Judge for that Point of Order."

35.text:
(Proposition 303) That the following be enacted as a new rule.

An accusation is made by writing in the voting thread "Accuse:" followed by the name of one player, and precise descriptions of any number of trangressions of the rules during the current day by the named player. Any player may make an accusation at any time on any day allocated to a player as per rule 201.

On each day when accusations may be made, a Penalty Setter shall be designated for each accusation made. This shall be the player who precedes the Judge for new points of order as per rule 214, except in cases where that player is accused. The Judge becomes the Penalty Setter in cases where the Penalty Setter would otherwise be the accused. The Penalty Setter for an accusation may, until the end of the day, set the penalty by writing a number of points in the voting thread preceded by "Set penalty:", with a reference to the accusation.

The penalty thus indicated must be one (but may be any) of those explicitly stated in one of the rules allegedly transgressed or 20 points if this is less. The penalty must be non-negative and can be at most 20 points. The stated penalty for transgressing a rule (or part thereof) whose transgression automatically changes the transgressor's points total is considered to be zero for the purposes of this rule.

For one hour subsequent to the penalty being set, each player other than the accused may once write either "Impose" or "Not impose" into the voting thread, with reference to the set penalty. Unless at least one player writes "Not impose", and as soon as this is determined, the penalty is imposed. If the penalty setter is the accuser, at least one other player must write "Impose" for the penalty to be imposed.

When a penalty is imposed, the accused player's points total immediately decreases by the amount indicated when the penalty was set.

Instead of setting a penalty, the Penalty Setter may write "Dismiss" in the voting thread with reference to an accusation if, in their opinion, one of the following is true: none of the alleged transgressions carries a substantive points penalty; the accusation is unclear, speculative, or spurious; the accusation pertains to a different day; or that at least one of the alleged transgressions has been the subject of a previous accusation. A brief reason for the dismissal may be appended to this message.

Upon the dismissal of an accusation the points total of the accuser immediately decreases by 5 points. There is a penalty of 10 points for dismissing an accusation except for the reasons outlined above.

A player may not make more than two accusations per day; there is a penalty of 10 points per accusation made after the second.

The general penalty for intentional non-compliance with this rule, or the misuse of the associated terminology in the voting thread is 5 points.

31.author: Initial
31.text:
If players disagree about the legality of a move or the interpretation or application of a rule, then any player may call for a Judgement on the decision. They do so by entering a message into the Telegram voting thread of the form “Point of Order:” followed by a description of the statement to be judged. The player whose allocated day preceded the current day is to be the Judge and decide the question. After considering the statement, they pronounce their verdict by typing “Judgement:” followed by their decision into the Telegram voting chat. This must reference the original Point of Order.

Following the pronouncement, there is a one hour period in which any of the other players may dispute the decision. They do this by typing “Dispute:” followed by a reference to the Judgement into the voting thread. Players other than the Judge then have one hour to each type either “I agree with Judgement...” or “I disagree with Judgement...” followed by a reference to the Judgement. If no one disputes the decision within an hour or a single player other than the Judge agrees then the decision comes into effect. This process is called invoking Judgment. Otherwise, i.e. a player disputed the Judgement and all the other players who expressed an opinion within one hour from the dispute unanimously disagreed with the Judge’s decision, the Judge is overruled.

If a Judge’s Judgment is overruled, then the player preceding the Judge in the order of Rule 201 becomes the new Judge for the Point of Order, and so on, except that no player is to be Judge during his or her own turn or during the turn of a team-mate.

Unless a Judge is overruled, one Judge settles all questions arising from the game until the next turn is begun, including questions as to his or her own legitimacy and jurisdiction as Judge.

If the Judge has not invoked Judgement by the end of the day, they forfeit their position as Judge on that Point of Order to the player preceding them in the order of days, excluding the player who’s allocated day it is or one of their teammates. The same applies for the new Judge. Any proposed rule-change involved in a dispute is voted on in the usual fashion, but if approved whilst still awaiting Judgement, the rule is not taken into effect until all the related Judgements are invoked. This has precedence over Rule 206 . All other actions under dispute are delayed until all relevant Judgements are invoked. A point of order may not be raised against a proposed rule-change for which voting has been completed but the rule-change has not yet come into effect.

Multiple Points of Order may be brought up simultaneously. No player may have more than three active points of order at any one time.

New Judges are not bound by the decisions of old Judges. New Judges may, however, settle only those questions on which the players currently disagree and that affect the completion of the turn in which Judgment was invoked. All decisions by Judges shall be in accordance with all the rules then in effect; but when the rules are silent, inconsistent, or unclear on the point at issue, then the Judge shall consider game-custom and the spirit of the game before applying other standards.

18.author: Initial
18.text:
Each player is allocated one day a week. These days are

Chris B Monday
Dave M Tuesday
Ben P Wednesday
Alex T Thursday
Alex W Friday

Any message posted in the voting thread on a Saturday or Sunday is to be considered void. All players begin with zero points.

22.author: Initial
22.text: If and when rule-changes can be adopted without unanimity, the players who vote against winning proposals shall receive 10 points each.

3.author: Initial
3.text: All rule-changes proposed in the proper way shall be voted on. They will be adopted if and only if they receive the required number of votes.

27.author: Initial
27.text: The winner is the first player to achieve 200 (positive) points.

In this case n shall be taken to be the net gain, if there is any. This does not preclude this rule being invoked for multiple players simultaneously."

30.author: Initial
30.text:
If two or more mutable rules conflict with one another, or if two or more immutable rules conflict with one another, then the rule with the lowest ordinal number takes precedence.

If at least one of the rules in conflict explicitly says of itself that it defers to another rule (or type of rule) or takes precedence over another rule (or type of rule), then such provisions shall supersede the numerical method for determining precedence.

If two or more rules claim to take precedence over one another or to defer to one another, then the numerical method again governs.
